meanings.definition: Include or absorb (something) in something else
meanings.sent1: The smaller ideas were subsumed into the larger concept.
meanings.sent2: The new data was subsumed into the final report.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy subsumed the treat in one big gulp.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music subsumed all other interests in her life.
meanings.sent5: The darkness subsumed the room, engulfing everything in its path.

meanings.definition: Considered as part of a general rule or principle
meanings.sent1: The subsumed details helped support the main argument.
meanings.sent2: The subsumed information provided a broader context.
meanings.sent3: The subsumed clause added an unexpected twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her subsumed beliefs shaped her worldview in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The subsumed elements created a cohesive and unified whole.
